page.title: 14LOCAL CHARITIES
page.content: The Parochial Charity is divided up into 5 different charities. They are the Beef Charity of Richard Drayson 1806,the charity of John Bucknill 1622,the Benjamin Cerr charity 1872, the poor lands charity 1776 and the charity of Sarah Ann Robinson 1874. All of these are based on money that was left.From the money that was left they put some in the bank and bought land with the rest. The income from the land and interest from the bank goes to the needy people of the village. {The Ashby Trust}is based on money that a Police Sergeant left.It was put into the bank and now gains interest twice a year.This goes to the trustees one of which is the Headteacher in Crick School. This money pays for the food and entertainment of the school's Christmas parties.
